If you have legendary proficiency in Intimidation, or if you have the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.class-features.Item.ajzZpzc8uMtgU6N8]{Action Hero} fighting style and the target of Collateral Witness is the enemy closest to you, you can use this as a free action with the same trigger.

Combat Climber.name: Trepador de combate
Combat Climber.description: Tu técnica te permite luchar mientras trepas. No estás @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Desprevenido} mientras Trepas y puedes Trepar con una mano ocupada. Sigues teniendo que utilizar la otra mano y ambas piernas para Trepar.

Combat Hack.name: Combat Hack
Combat Hack.description:
Requirements You are holding or wearing a hacking toolkit and have a free hand.

Attempt a Computers check to [[/act hack]]{Hack} an adjacent creature, hazard, or item with the tech trait. The DC is equal to the creature, item, or hazard's Fortitude DC, or the Fortitude DC of the creature attending the object. If the target is an unattended object, the GM sets the DC for the check based on the item's level. The target is temporarily immune to your attempts to Combat Hack it for 10 minutes.

Critical Success The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.6A2QDy8wRGCVQsSd]{glitching 2}.

Success The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.6A2QDy8wRGCVQsSd]{glitching 1}.

Critical Failure If the target has the glitching condition, reduce the value of its glitching condition by 1.

Combat Reflexes.name: Combat Reflexes
Combat Reflexes.description: Your extensive training has transformed you into a living weapon, ready to pull the trigger at a moment's notice. At the start of each enemy's turn, you gain an additional reaction during that turn that you can use only for an operative reaction.

Combine.name: Combine
Combine.description:
Frequency once per day

You temporarily merge your body with that of an adjacent willing creature, overlaying yourself atop them to better shield them from harm. This transformation lasts for 10 minutes. You can Dismiss this effect. When you do, you emerge in a space adjacent to the target you merged with. While combined, you and your target each take your own turns as normal and must be targeted separately for the purposes of abilities and other effects. Additionally, you and your target gain the following benefits.

  • If the target is Medium or smaller, their size increases to Large and their reach increases to 10 feet.
  • You occupy the target's space and can't take actions with the move trait. If the target moves, you move with them.
  • For each Speed you possess, compare it to that of your target. If your Speed is faster, or they lack that Speed, they gain your Speed.
  • Your body shields the target from harm, granting them greater cover, though you don't gain cover. Your body doesn't obscure the target's vision or block line of sight.

Come Get Some!.name: Come Get Some!
Come Get Some!.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger You are reduced to 0 Hit Points and would fall @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}.

You fight on to the absolute last, pushing yourself to make one final attack at a foe. Make a Strike with a –2 circumstance penalty, or make an @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire} or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.6ctkxUnVwqooSvgg]{Auto-Fire} attack ignoring the unwieldy trait and with the save DC decreased by 2. After the attack is concluded, you immediately fall unconscious and gain the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying} condition.

Command Tactics.name: Command Tactics
Command Tactics.description: You're a skilled leader. Whenever an ally selects you as the target of their attempts to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.tfa4Sh7wcxCEqL29]{Follow the Expert}, you increase the circumstance bonus they receive to their skill check by an additional +1, or an additional +2 if you have master proficiency or higher (for a total of +3 for expert, +5 for master, and +6 for legendary).

Commanding Pheromones.name: Commanding Pheromones
Commanding Pheromones.description: You can leverage your alluring pheromones to soothe ill will and take the edge off your threats, turning your attempts at coercion into acts of leadership. When you @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.tHCqgwjtQtzNqVvd]{Coerce} a creature, if your target would become unfriendly (and they aren't already unfriendly or hostile), they become indifferent instead.

Communal Crafting.name: Artesanía comunal
Communal Crafting.description:
Puedes hacer que otros PJs te ayuden a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.rmwa3OyhTZ2i2AHl]{elaborar} un objeto, bajo tu dirección. Un PJ ayudante hace una prueba en una habilidad en la que está entrenado. Dicha habilidad tiene que ser Artesanía u otra relevante al objeto, a determinar por el DJ. Por ejemplo, un PJ podría utilizar Religión para ayudarte a Fabricar un objeto con el rasgo Divino o Saber (guerra) para ayudarte a Fabricar una arma. Sigue siendo tu tirada la que determina si consigues crear con éxito el objeto. Las tiradas de cualquier ayudante contribuyen a reducir el coste de materia prima utilizando las cifras de la tabla @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QyzlsLrqM0EEwd7j]{Obtener ingresos}; esto utiliza el rango de competencia del PJ en la habilidad y su nivel -1 para su nivel.

Los PJs ayudantes te tienen que acompañar a lo largo de la actividad de Artesanía (lo que les impide dedicarse a otras actividades de tiempo libre) o el beneficio se pierde. El DJ podría determinar que tan sólo cierto número de PJs pueden ayudarte dependiendo de las circunstancias.

Artesanía comunal también te permite adoptar el papel de un ayudante cuando alguien más está elaborando algo, siempre y cuando acepte tu ayuda.

Communalism.name: Communalism
Communalism.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger An ally within 10 feet fails a skill check requiring 3 actions or fewer.

You broadcast helpful encouragement or pertinent information to your ally's mind. Your ally rerolls the triggering skill check and takes the better result.

Compact Predator.name: Compact Predator
Compact Predator.description:
You may be small, but your body is a dangerous weapon, sporting either long talons, razor-sharp teeth, or curving horns. When you select this feat, you gain your choice of a claw unarmed attack, a horn unarmed attack, or a jaws unarmed attack. These attacks are in the brawling weapon group.

  • A claw unarmed attack deals 1d6 slashing damage and has the agile, finesse, ikeshti, and unarmed traits.
  • A horn unarmed attack deals 1d6 bludgeoning damage and has the disarm, ikeshti, shove, and unarmed traits.
  • A jaws unarmed attack deals 1d6 piercing damage and has the grapple, ikeshti, and unarmed traits.

At 5th level, whenever you get a critical hit with one of these attacks, you get its critical specialization effect.

Special You can take this feat up to three times. Each time you do, select a different attack from the options above.

Competitive Spirit.name: Competitive Spirit
Competitive Spirit.description:
Frequency once per hour

Trigger An ally attempts a skill check with a skill that you have trained or better proficiency rank in.

You push yourself to be the best by competing with the triggering ally. Until the end of your next turn, you can attempt the same skill check to perform the same action or activity that the triggering ally performed. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to this skill check. If you achieve at least one degree of success higher than the triggering ally, this use of Competitive Spirit doesn't count toward its frequency. If you roll a critical failure on this skill check, you take a –1 circumstance penalty to all skill checks attempted with that skill for the next hour as you try new techniques to improve your future attempts.

Complete Transposition.name: Complete Transposition
Complete Transposition.description: The multiverse is a complex game—you use alternate realities to move creatures on the board. When you use the Sustain action to move your quantum field, you can teleport any number of creatures within the quantum field's original area to squares of your choice in its new area. You also teleport any items they're wearing or holding. This gives the Sustain action the teleportation trait. Each target can attempt a @Check[will|against:witchwarper|options:area-effect] save against your class DC. Targets who succeed at the save are unaffected.

Conceal Spell.name: Ocultar conjuro
Conceal Spell.description:
Animista Hablas con la voz inaudible de los espíritus.

Brujo Mediante un gran esfuerzo mental, puedes simplificar los conjuros y gestos necesarios para lanzar hechizos, haciendo que sean apenas perceptibles.

Mago Al moldear las energías mágicas y los parámetros de tus hechizos en tu mente mediante una gran concentración, puedes simplificar los conjuros y gestos necesarios para lanzar hechizos, haciendo que sean apenas perceptibles.

Si la siguiente acción que realizas es lanzar un hechizo, este obtiene el rasgo disimulado, ocultando las runas brillantes, las chispas de magia y otras manifestaciones que normalmente delatarían tu lanzamiento de hechizos. El rasgo sólo oculta las acciones y manifestaciones del lanzamiento del hechizo, no sus efectos, por lo que un observador aún podría ver un rayo salir disparado de ti o verte desaparecer en el aire.

Concentrated Shot.name: Concentrated Shot
Concentrated Shot.description:
Requirements You're wielding an automatic weapon.

Focusing your fire enables you to target an enemy for immediate destruction. Make a ranged Strike with an automatic weapon, expending three times the ammo and gaining a +4 circumstance bonus to damage. This bonus increases to +6 at 11th level and +8 at 15th level.

Confident Actualization.name: Confident Actualization
Confident Actualization.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger You're about to attempt a saving throw or skill check.

Your utter confidence in your own abilities helps you push yourself to reach your desired goals. Roll the triggering check or save twice and use the better result.

Confounding Disquisition.name: Confounding Disquisition
Confounding Disquisition.description:
You attempt to enthrall a foe with a convoluted and utterly pointless monologue that leaves your audience dumbfounded. Attempt a @Check[deception|against:will|options:inflicts:stupefied,inflicts:stunned] or @Check[diplomacy|against:will|options:inflicts:stupefied,inflicts:stunned] check against the Will DC of a single creature within 30 feet. The target is then temporarily immune to your Confounding Disquisition for 1 day.

Critical Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} and is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 round.

Success The target is stupefied 1 for 1 round.

Failure The target takes a –1 status penalty to Perception checks and Will saves for 1 round.

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feat-effects.Item.YI60jVAgutn1YrI7]{Effect: Confounding Disquisition (Failure)}

Critical Failure The target is unaffected.

Congregant's Acumen.name: Congregant's Acumen
Congregant's Acumen.description: You're determined to amass a fortune and send a portion of the profits back home. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feats.Item.BocFD2KV0qgUC76x]{Additional Lore} general feat for one Lore skill of your choice—the Lore you choose must be related to your business or profession, such as Accounting Lore, Corporate Lore, or Legal Lore. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus on checks to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.QyzlsLrqM0EEwd7j]{Earn Income} with your chosen Lore. In addition, whenever you successfully Earn Income, you earn an additional 10%. This additional income is transferred directly to your home community's accounts and can't be accessed or used by you in any way.

Consistent Communalism.name: Consistent Communalism
Consistent Communalism.description: You're always ready to help your allies when they need you the most. You can use Communalism once per hour, rather than once per day.

Constellation Vortex.name: Constellation Vortex
Constellation Vortex.description:
You manifest a copy of your solar weapon, causing it to circle around you in a vortex, leaving constellation patterns in its wake. A creature that starts its turn adjacent to you takes damage of an amount and type equal to the weapon damage of your solar weapon, with a @Check[reflex|against:solarian|basic] save against your class DC. If you already have an active vortex when you use Constellation Vortex, add another weapon to the vortex instead, up to a maximum of 3 weapons at any time. Each added weapon increases the damage of the vortex by 1. You can Sustain the vortex for up to 1 minute.

When the vortex ends, it shatters, dealing damage equal to your level, plus 1 for each weapon in the vortex, to all adjacent creatures. This damage is of the same type as your solar weapon.

Graviton-Attuned Increase the damage of the vortex by 2 per weapon (including the first).

Photon-Attuned Add @Damage[1[fire]] damage per weapon (including the first).

Level (+3) The damage from each additional weapon increases by 2, and the extra damage from your attunement effect increases by 1.

Consume Flesh.name: Consume Flesh
Consume Flesh.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements You are adjacent to the corpse of a Small or larger creature who has died in the last day.

Your undead metabolism has evolved in ways that allow you to gain some small measure of sustenance and healing from the consumption of the recently dead. This might be the act of eating their flesh, fusing their bones with yours, or a combination of other activities that your companions might find to be gruesome. Regardless, it nourishes and replenishes you. You regain 1d6 Hit Points for every level you have (@Damage[(@actor.level)d6[healing]]).

Contemplative Lore.name: Contemplative Lore
Contemplative Lore.description:
After extensive study of historical records, legends, and myths, you have absorbed the essential teachings of contemplative society. You gain the trained proficiency rank in Arcana and Occultism. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.

You also gain the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feats.Item.BocFD2KV0qgUC76x]{Additional Lore} general feat for Contemplative Lore.

Continual Recovery.name: Recuperación continua
Continual Recovery.description: Controlas celosamente los progresos de un paciente a fin de administrar su tratamiento con mayor rapidez. Cuando @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1kGNdIIhuglAjIp9]{Tratas heridas}, tu paciente queda inmune tan sólo durante 10 minutos en lugar de 1 hora. Esto sólo se aplica a tus actividades de Tratar heridas, no a ninguna otra que recibe el paciente.

Contortive Compression.name: Contortive Compression
Contortive Compression.description: Contorting your limbs as though you were transforming allows you to fit through tight spaces. You can move at full Speed while Squeezing.

Convergent Evolution.name: Convergent Evolution
Convergent Evolution.description: You sample the genetics of creatures and people you've made contact with and mimic them. When you take this feat, select up to three different ancestries with which you've had significant contact. You can select ancestry feats from the ancestries you chose, in addition to barathu ancestry feats. Additionally, you gain one ancestry feat you qualify for of 5th level or lower from one of the selected ancestries. You can retrain the selected feat once per day during your daily preparations.

Convert Elemental Essence.name: Convert Elemental Essence
Convert Elemental Essence.description:
Trigger An enemy targets a bonded creature with a Strike or spell with an attack roll that has an elemental trait and the roll fails or critically fails, or you roll a critical success on a save against a foe's harmful elemental spell.

Your vitality network absorbs the essence of the attack. Your vitality network regains 2 Hit Points per rank of the triggering spell or 4 Hit Points per weapon die of the triggering Strike.

Convert Illumination.name: Convert Illumination
Convert Illumination.description:
Trigger An area within 60 feet has its light level reduced due to magical darkness.

Your vitality network regains Hit Points equal to the spell rank of the magical darkness if the affected area was normally dim light, and doubled if the affected area was normally bright light. Even if the magical darkness ends, the area's light level remains non-magical darkness for 1 minute; this effect removes light in the area but isn't magical darkness and is automatically overcome by any form of magical light.

Convert Information.name: Convert Information
Convert Information.description: Analyzing your enemies gives you a greater understanding of the ties that bond all things and helps synchronize your connection to the Akashic Record. Attempt a @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} check against an enemy you're observing. On a success, in addition to the normal benefits, your vitality network regains 10 Hit Points. On a critical success, it regains 20 Hit Points.

Convert Life Force.name: Convert Life Force
Convert Life Force.description: With extreme concentration, you can sacrifice your own Hit Points to recharge your vitality network. Your vitality network regains Hit Points equal to the amount you sacrifice.

Convert Tempo.name: Convert Tempo
Convert Tempo.description:
Frequency once per minute

You dance across the battlefield, magically converting your body's kinetic energy into magical potential. Stride a number of times equal to the actions you used. Your vitality network regains 10 Hit Points per Stride you took.

Cooperative.name: Cooperative
Cooperative.description:
You work well on a team, and you're always ready to lend a hand and accept the help offered by others. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to checks to Aid, and your allies gain a +2 circumstance bonus to checks to Aid you.

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feat-effects.Item.xYipnklm52BcgwSD]{Effect: Cooperative}

Cooperative Nature.name: Naturaleza cooperativa
Cooperative Nature.description: La corta esperanza de vida humana concede perspectiva y te ha enseñado desde una edad temprana a dejar a un lado las diferencias y trabajar con otros para llegar a la grandeza. Obtienes un bonificador +4 por circunstancia a las pruebas de Prestar ayuda.

Coordinated Fire.name: Coordinated Fire
Coordinated Fire.description:
Requirements You're wielding an area or automatic weapon.

With a mighty bellow, you unload your weapon to give your allies the cover they need to rally. You Area Fire or Auto-Fire without selecting a primary target. Give a verbal order as part of your firing, selecting either Reload, Strike, or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.ust1jJSCZQUhBZIz]{Take Cover}. Every ally within 30 feet who hears and understands your order can perform the action you selected as a reaction.

Corona.name: Corona
Corona.description:
You unleash a corona of stellar energy in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10], which lasts until the end of your next turn. You can Sustain your Corona for up to 1 minute. If your attunement changes, your Corona's attunement effect changes to match. While graviton-attuned, your Corona has the darkness trait. While photon-attuned, your Corona has the light trait.

Graviton-Attuned Your Corona is darkness that prevents light from penetrating the area. This acts as a @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.4GE2ZdODgIQtg51c]{Darkness} spell with a spell rank equal to half your level.

Photon-Attuned Your Corona is solar light that sheds bright light in the area (and dim light for the next 20 feet). While within your Corona's bright light, @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.zJxUflt9np0q4yML]{Invisible} creatures become @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, and creatures already concealed are no longer concealed.

Coronal Flare.name: Coronal Flare
Coronal Flare.description: Ambient solar energy manifests in your attacks. You gain a solar strike unarmed attack that requires a free hand to use unless you have manifested energy wings. This is an agile, finesse, unarmed attack in the flame weapon group that deals 1d6 fire damage.

Corporate Speak.name: Corporate Speak
Corporate Speak.description: You can share hidden messages using technical business and corporate jargon, using Business or Corporate Lore to disguise the true meaning of your words. Any allies who have traveled alongside you for at least 1 full week or are trained in the same Lore skill automatically discern your meaning. Other observers must succeed at a Perception check against your Business or Corporate Lore DC to realize you're passing a secret message, and they must critically succeed to understand the message.

Corpsefolk Lore.name: Corpsefolk Lore
Corpsefolk Lore.description: Becoming undead has given you unique insight. You learn how to speak and understand the Necril language, and you become trained in Undead Lore, a skill that allows you to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} about all kinds of undead regardless of subtype. At 5th level, your proficiency in Undead Lore increases to expert.

Corrosive Venting.name: Corrosive Venting
Corrosive Venting.description: You can control causticity as you vent your gases. When you Vent Gas, increase the area of your emanation to 10 feet. You can choose to make the gas you vent caustic. If you do, any non-barathu creature that enters the emanation or starts its turn in the area takes @Damage[3d6[acid]] damage, with a @Check[reflex|against:class-spell|basic] save against your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher. On a critical failure, a creature additionally takes @Damage[1d4[persistent,acid]] damage. At 17th level, the acid damage increases by 2d6, and the persistent acid damage increases by 1d4.

Cosmic Alignment.name: Cosmic Alignment
Cosmic Alignment.description: You reach true alignment with the cosmic cycle. You're permanently @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.nlCjDvLMf2EkV2dl]{Quickened}. You can use your extra action only to Attune or make a Strike with your solar flare or solar weapon.

Cosmic Caster.name: Cosmic Caster
Cosmic Caster.description: You have the ability to convert ambient solar radiation and other stellar energy into pure magical light. You gain @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.Sqo1uzSmebVWpqoT]{Wisp Ally} as a 1st-rank arcane innate spell and gain @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.2ZdHjnpEQJuqOYSG]{Floating Flame} and @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.0qaqksrGGDj74HXE]{Revealing Light} as 2nd-rank arcane innate spells. You can cast each of these spells as arcane innate spells once per day.

Cosmic Infusion.name: Cosmic Infusion
Cosmic Infusion.description:
You infuse your attunements with additional energy. When you deal fire damage or persistent fire damage due to being photon-attuned, you can instead choose to deal vitality damage or persistent vitality damage, which damages creatures with void healing, such as undead.

While graviton-attuned, Strikes with your solar weapon cause the target to count all squares within 10 feet as difficult terrain, rather than just adjacent squares.

Cosmic Traveler.name: Cosmic Traveler
Cosmic Traveler.description: The Drift is your true home, and you can survive within it indefinitely. While you're in the Drift, you gain the cosmic trait, and you don't need to eat or drink. While you're in the Drift or a vacuum, you gain a fly Speed equal to your land Speed.

Covering Fire.name: Covering Fire
Covering Fire.description:
You make a well placed shot or unleash a hail of fire to cover your allies. Make a ranged Strike against a target and select one ally within range of the same attack. If your Strike hits your target, you deal no damage, but the targeted creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppressed} and takes a –2 circumstance penalty on attacks made against your ally until the end of your next turn.

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feat-effects.Item.0kdfFVZuHoHTG5c0]{Effect: Covering Fire}

You can use Covering Fire as a 2-action activity to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire} or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.6ctkxUnVwqooSvgg]{Auto-Fire} instead of making a ranged Strike, affecting targets that fail their save.

Covering Flare.name: Covering Flare
Covering Flare.description: You use your solar flare to cover yourself as you close in on your foes. You Stride twice; at any point during this movement, you can make a solar flare Strike. On a hit, the target is also suppressed until the end of its next turn.

Craft Anything.name: Elaborar cualquier cosa
Craft Anything.description: Puedes encontrar formas para elaborar casi cualquier cosa, a pesar de las restricciones. Mientras dispongas de la dote de habilidad de Artesanía apropiada (como por ejemplo Artesanía mágica para objetos mágicos) y cumplas con el requisito de nivel de objeto de competencia, podrás ignorar casi cualquier otro requisito, como por ejemplo pertenecer a una ascendencia específica o proporcionar conjuros. Si un requisito incrementa el coste del objeto, sigues teniendo que pagarlo (incluyendo el lanzamiento de conjuros que tienen un coste de por sí). No puedes ignorar los requisitos de objetos especiales que tienen medios de acceso y de Artesanía exclusivos, como por ejemplo los artefactos. El DJ es quien decide si puedes ignorar o no un requisito.

Creative Combat.name: Creative Combat
Creative Combat.description:
Through experimentation, manipulation, or perhaps just due to natural wear and tear of your limbs, you are able to use your natural weaponry in more creative ways than just bashing, stabbing, or biting. Select two of the traits from the following list and add them to your ancestry's unarmed attacks: backstabber, backswing, concussive, disarm, forceful, parry, shove, sweep, and trip.

Special Partial corpsefolk characters may apply this feat's benefit to the knives they create with their lineage ability.

Crew Member.name: Crew Member
Crew Member.description:
Trigger An ally within 30 feet attempts to Aid and rolls a failure.

You're always able to help in a pinch. Attempt a skill check or attack roll of the same type attempted by your ally and replace the result of the failed Aid with your result, even if you didn't prepare to help.

Crowd Control.name: Crowd Control
Crowd Control.description:
Your voice can be heard over the noise in a crowd. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Diplomacy checks against crowds. The first time each round you Stride into a square containing a crowd, you can attempt a @Check[diplomacy|dc:20] check to move the crowd out of your way. A GM might use a different DC under certain circumstances, such as when the crowd has a level or set DC to disperse.

Critical Success As success, and the crowd departs from all adjacent squares as you move.

Success The crowd disperses from squares you move into.

Failure The crowd doesn't move, but you can continue moving.

Critical Failure The crowd forcefully resists you and disrupts your Stride.

Crowd Surfing.name: Crowd Surfing
Crowd Surfing.description: You move through crowds without slowing down. You can move at full Speed in crowds. Treat areas truly packed with people as difficult terrain instead of greater difficult terrain.

Crushing Fists.name: Crushing Fists
Crushing Fists.description: Your fists are exceptionally effective weapons. The damage die for your fist unarmed attack increases to a d6 and it gains the grapple weapon trait.

Current Rider.name: Current Rider
Current Rider.description: You ride air currents, electromagnetic waves, and solar energy like a parachute. You take no damage from falling regardless of the distance you fall.

Cut 'Em Deep.name: Cut 'Em Deep
Cut 'Em Deep.description:
Your insults and threats almost always hit the mark. When you roll a failure on a @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} action, you get a success instead. You can still critically fail.

When you successfully Demoralize the target of your @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.cmCtfURzpbzkxWsy]{Get 'Em!}, the target doesn't become immune to your further attempts to Demoralize them.

Cyclone.name: Cyclone
Cyclone.description:
Requirements You aren't in a vacuum.

You take inspiration from schools of hunting manta rays, creating a vortex to draw in your foe before striking. You spin in place and can attempt an @Check[athletics|against:fortitude] check against the Fortitude DC of all creatures within 20 feet of you (or 40 feet if you and the target are in water). On a success, that creature is moved adjacent to you. On a critical success, it's also knocked @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. If a creature is within melee reach of you after this check is resolved, you can Strike that creature.

Damoritosh's Claw.name: Damoritosh's Claw
Damoritosh's Claw.description:
Frequency once per day

Requirements You're engaged in combat.

You pray to Damoritosh (or a battle saint) for a blessing in the heat of battle—and he answers. You regain 1 Focus Point, up to your usual maximum.

Damoritosh's Grip.name: Damoritosh's Grip
Damoritosh's Grip.description: You have become a legendary soldier on par with the saints of Damoritosh and need not choose between the destructive power of your firearm and the honor of your personal armament. You can wield two-handed weapons in one hand.

Dance!.name: Dance!
Dance!.description:
You compel enemies to avoid your attacks by aiming at their legs, wings, or other forms of movement to make them easier to outmaneuver. When you @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.enA7BxAjBb7ns1iF]{Suppress} a target with one of your attacks, it also becomes @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} until the start of its turn.

In addition, when Auto-Firing in a cone that affects only a single target, that target takes a –1 circumstance penalty to Reflex saves against the Auto-Fire attack.

Danger Awareness.name: Danger Awareness
Danger Awareness.description: You have an intuitive sense that alerts you to danger and allows you to discern the presence of hidden threats. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to find traps and @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}, and @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.9evPzg9E6muFcoSk]{Unnoticed} creatures; to AC against attacks made by traps and hidden, undetected, and unnoticed creatures; and to saves against traps. Even if you aren't @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.TiNDYUGlMmxzxBYU]{Searching}, you get a check to find traps that normally require you to be Searching. You still need to meet any other requirements to find the trap. If your initiative result is tied with an opponent, you always go first.

Danger Zone.name: Danger Zone
Danger Zone.description: Your quantum field merges with a more dangerous reality, becoming hazardous terrain that deals 1 damage to an enemy each time it enters a square in the area. You choose the damage type when you use Danger Zone, selecting from the following: @Damage[(max(1,(floor(@actor.level / 4) - 1)))[acid]|options:area-damage]{acid}, @Damage[(max(1,(floor(@actor.level / 4) - 1)))[bludgeoning]|options:area-damage]{bludgeoning}, @Damage[(max(1,(floor(@actor.level / 4) - 1)))[cold]|options:area-damage]{cold}, @Damage[(max(1,(floor(@actor.level / 4) - 1)))[electricity]|options:area-damage]{electricity}, @Damage[(max(1,(floor(@actor.level / 4) - 1)))[fire]|options:area-damage]{fire}, @Damage[(max(1,(floor(@actor.level / 4) - 1)))[piercing]|options:area-damage]{piercing}, @Damage[(max(1,(floor(@actor.level / 4) - 1)))[slashing]|options:area-damage]{slashing}, or @Damage[(max(1,(floor(@actor.level / 4) - 1)))[sonic]|options:area-damage]{sonic}. Increase the damage by 1 at 12th, 16th, and 20th levels.

Darkvision Adaptation.name: Darkvision Adaptation
Darkvision Adaptation.description: You've explored the darkest regions of space and found ways to adapt. You gain darkvision.

Data Bond.name: Data Bond
Data Bond.description: You can speak with computers. Any construct creatures you summon are considered part of your bond and don't count against the maximum number of creatures in your bond. During your daily preparations, choose one of the following spells: @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.mnoTqz0gjRmuc4oR]{Instant Virus}, @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.dINQzhqGmIsqGMUY]{Mending}, @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.lKcsmeOrgHtK4xQa]{Summon Construct}, or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.KlJEDmAOk1ztdNFf]{Summon Robot}. You add the selected spell to your spell repertoire and signature spells until your next daily preparations.

Data Jockey.name: Data Jockey
Data Jockey.description: You can easily send data to technological devices like a spectra. You can cast the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.ZBeKxBcUOsXrfMRo]{Implant Data} cantrip as a divine innate spell at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell rank equal to half your level rounded up.

Dauntless.name: Dauntless
Dauntless.description: You're rarely discouraged or afraid. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saves against fear and to your Will DC against attempts to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} you. If you get a success on a save against a fear effect, you get a critical success instead.

Dazzling Diversion.name: Dazzling Diversion
Dazzling Diversion.description: You concentrate ambient energy into a burst of light. Using the flash as cover, you use the Stealth skill to Hide, and then you @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} up to twice.

Dazzling Glare.name: Dazzling Glare
Dazzling Glare.description: Through practice, you've learned how to increase the intensity of your bioluminescence. The range of your bioluminescence increases to 50 feet. Your dazzling glare misleads your foes, allowing you to use the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feint} action against a creature within the range of your bioluminescence, and applies to ranged attacks.

Dead Nerves.name: Dead Nerves
Dead Nerves.description: Without nerve endings, you can put your body up against hazards and obstacles without caring about bruising. Stride twice. Once during this movement, if you pass through or end adjacent to a door, window, wall, or similar obstacle, you can attempt an Athletics check to [[/act force-open options=dead-nerves]] that obstacle with a +1 circumstance bonus to the roll. On a failure, your movement immediately ends.

Deadlift.name: Deadlift
Deadlift.description:
Requirements You aren't @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued}.

For 1 minute, you can carry 4 more Bulk than normal before becoming encumbered. The amount you can carry increases to 6 at expert, 8 at master, and 10 at legendary. When the benefits of this feat end, you become @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} for 10 minutes.

Death Blossom.name: Death Blossom
Death Blossom.description:
Requirements You're wielding an area or automatic weapon with a full magazine.

Spinning in place, you fire indiscriminately to completely clear out the room. You @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.oc0ZKnk5zD0GXqZi]{Area Fire} (even if using an automatic weapon), affecting each creature in an emanation around you with a radius equal to the range of the weapon, expending the weapon's entire magazine. Creatures in the area take a –1 circumstance penalty to Reflex saves against this attack due to the cataclysmic nature of the raining fire. You don't designate a primary target with this attack.

Death Eternal.name: Death Eternal
Death Eternal.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger You are reduced to 0 Hit Points and would gain the dying condition.

You're not ready for the Boneyard. Roll a @Check[flat|dc:11|showDC:all]. On a success, you remain standing with 1 Hit Point instead of being reduced to 0 Hit Points with the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying} condition.

Death's Advance.name: Death's Advance
Death's Advance.description:
2 or 3

Your magically preserved corpse can plow through obstacles and ignore strain in ways the living cannot. Stride twice, or three times if you spent 3 actions to Death's Advance. During this movement, you ignore difficult terrain and greater difficult terrain. Once per day, you can choose to ignore all circumstance and status penalties to your Speed when you use Death's Advance.

Death's Indifference.name: Death's Indifference
Death's Indifference.description: Your skin and bones have weathered down to the point where certain types of damage no longer have the same effect on them as when you were counted among the living. You gain resistance to a specific damage type equal to half your level. Biting corpsefolk gain resistance to slashing damage, partial corpsefolk gain resistance to piercing damage, and shambling corpsefolk gain resistance to bludgeoning damage.

Death-Touched Caster.name: Death-Touched Caster
Death-Touched Caster.description:
You exist on the boundaries between life and death, and you can channel your own imbalanced spiritual essence into magical spells. Choose one of the following cantrips: @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.kcelf6IHl3L9VXXg]{Vitality Lash} or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.mAMEt4FFbdqoRnkN]{Void Warp}. You can cast this spell as a divine innate spell at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell rank equal to half your level rounded up.

Special You can select this feat twice. Each time, you must select a different cantrip.

Deathless Study.name: Deathless Study
Deathless Study.description: Your long existence has given you time to train and insights worth several mortal lifetimes. You become trained in two skills of your choice.

Deathly Constitution.name: Deathly Constitution
Deathly Constitution.description: Thanks to your life-altering brush with death, your living body is better protected against the weaknesses of the flesh. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Fortitude saves against disease and poison.

Debris Zone.name: Debris Zone
Debris Zone.description: Whether it's covered in debris, partially flooded, or otherwise troublesome to traverse, the area of your quantum field becomes difficult terrain.

Deep Diplomat.name: Deep Diplomat
Deep Diplomat.description: You've studied the history of the Deep Current Alliance, and you understand the value of turning an enemy into a friend. When you succeed on a Diplomacy check to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression} against an opponent that's hostile, you critically succeed instead.

Deepspeaker.name: Deepspeaker
Deepspeaker.description: You're descended from a long line of deepspeakers, dating back to an ancestor who served as liaison for a linnorm. You've been chosen to carry on the tradition, learning secrets passed down through generations of your people. You become trained in Performance and gain the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feats.Item.xqAdXRd2gSQcqp5E]{Impressive Performance} skill feat.

Defensive Formation.name: Defensive Formation
Defensive Formation.description:
Requirements You're adjacent to at least two of your allies.

You instinctively understand how your allies act and move, and use that knowledge in the heat of combat to adopt a defensive formation that better shields you from harm. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to AC and Reflex saving throws. If one of these adjacent allies is your bonded partner, that bonded partner gains the same benefit that you do. This benefit lasts until you are no longer adjacent to at least two of your allies.

Defensive Gunner.name: Defensive Gunner
Defensive Gunner.description: You've learned to defend yourself with only a gun, shielding your body and deflecting blows with stock and barrel. Guns you wield gain the parry trait. If an appropriate weapon already has the parry trait, increase the circumstance bonus to AC it grants when used to parry from +1 to +2.

Defiant Liberation.name: Defiant Liberation
Defiant Liberation.description: You can leverage your instinctive magical abilities to liberate the body and mind. You gain @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.EfFMLVbmkBWmzoLF]{Clear Mind} and @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.aqRYNoSvxsVfqglH]{Unfettered Movement} as 4th-rank arcane innate spells. You can cast each of these spells as arcane innate spells once per day.

Defy Gravity.name: Defy Gravity
Defy Gravity.description: You break the bonds of gravity. While graviton-attuned, you gain a fly Speed equal to your Speed.

Deific Obedience.name: Deific Obedience
Deific Obedience.description: You've dedicated yourself to a deity or pantheon. As long as you follow the edicts and anathema of that deity, you gain their granted 1st-rank spell as a divine innate spell you can cast once per day, heightened to 3rd rank; if you're legendary, the spell is heightened to 4th rank. If you repeatedly break your deity's edicts or perform anathemas, you lose this ability, and it can only be regained with an atone ritual.

Dermal Spikes.name: Dermal Spikes
Dermal Spikes.description: Spiky protrusions jut from your body, which you can use to wound your attackers. Your Fortitude DC against Athletics checks to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple} or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove} you increases by 1. Additionally, you gain the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.ZVzoIaWpXs62QVcu]{Piercing Spikes} reaction.

Destructive Dash.name: Destructive Dash
Destructive Dash.description:
Requirements You're in an environment with suitable material to tear up, such as an urban environment.

You dash across the battlefield, tearing up your surroundings and toppling nearby objects as you go to make it harder for your foes to maneuver or to give chase. Stride up to your Speed. The squares you move through become difficult terrain.

A creature within reach of one of the affected squares can clear the area with an Interact action, removing any difficult terrain you created in the square.

Determined Optimist.name: Determined Optimist
Determined Optimist.description:
You refuse to give up or give in to despair, even when all seems hopeless. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against emotion and fear effects. If you roll a success on a saving throw against an emotion or fear effect, you get a critical success instead.

Special You can't select this feat if you have the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feats.Item.ZiyExMCbCKHwgbzh]{Heightened Paranoia} feat.

Devastating Aim.name: Devastating Aim
Devastating Aim.description: Your well-placed shots inflict devastating wounds on your targets. When you Aim, increase the precision damage dice from d4s to d6s.

Diehard.name: Duro de pelar
Diehard.description: Matarte resulta más difícil que a la mayoría de personas. Si estás @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Moribundo}, mueres a moribundo 5, en lugar de a moribundo 4.

Digestive Outburst.name: Digestive Outburst
Digestive Outburst.description: You disgorge your stomach to attack your opponents with powerful enzymes. You gain a stomach unarmed attack that deals 1d8 acid damage damage, has the analog and unwieldy traits, and is in the corrosive weapon group.

Digestive Spray.name: Digestive Spray
Digestive Spray.description:
Frequency once per day

You force your body to produce an excess of powerful corrosive digestive enzymes that you can use to spray in a @Template[type:cone|distance:30], dealing @Damage[7d6[acid]] damage (@Check[reflex|against:class-spell|basic] save against the higher of your class DC or spell DC). A creature that gets a critical failure on this Reflex save is also @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Digital Ambassador.name: Digital Ambassador
Digital Ambassador.description: As long as you're using a comm unit, datapad, or computer to communicate, when you attempt to use a skill action with the linguistic trait on a creature that doesn't understand the language you're using, roll a @Check[flat|dc:15]. On a success, the effect works as if the creature understood the language you're using. If you're Legendary in Society, the DC is 10 (@Check[flat|dc:10]).

Digital Diversion.name: Digital Diversion
Digital Diversion.description:
Requirements You are holding or wearing a hacking toolkit and have a free hand.

Whether it's a sudden comm unit ping or a warning alarm on an equipment display, you can @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.GkmbTGfg8KcgynOA]{Create a Diversion} by using Computers instead of Deception on an adjacent target carrying, wearing, or wielding a tech item.

[[/act create-a-diversion variant=distracting-words skill=computers]]

[[/act create-a-diversion variant=gesture skill=computers]]

[[/act create-a-diversion variant=trick skill=computers]]

Dirty Retort.name: Dirty Retort
Dirty Retort.description:
Trigger A creature misses you with a melee Strike.

You turn the tables on your attacker, using underhanded tactics to temporarily hinder it, such as throwing dirt in its eyes, shining a light in its face, pulling its coat over its head, or otherwise being a meddlesome nuisance. The triggering creature becomes your choice of @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.i3OJZU2nk64Df3xm]{Clumsy 1} or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.MIRkyAjyBeXivMa7]{Enfeebled 1} until the end of its next turn.

Disarming Shot.name: Disarming Shot
Disarming Shot.description:
Requirements You're wielding a gun.

You attempt to disarm your foe with a well-aimed shot. You @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.sLikawnrJJzHMYeC]{Aim} and then make a ranged Strike against your mark. If the Strike hits, attempt to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.Dt6B1slsBy8ipJu9]{Disarm} the target using the same ranged attack roll against the target's Reflex DC, instead of attempting an Athletics check. A Disarming Shot counts as two attacks for your multiple attack penalty, but the penalty doesn't increase until after you've used Disarming Shot.

Disciple of the Cycle.name: Disciple of the Cycle
Disciple of the Cycle.description: While it pales in comparison to the powers of a true solarian, you are a devoted disciple of the Cycle and can temporarily manifest control over the powers of the cosmos. You gain @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.kR5A0h2a9hY41wav]{Entropy Strike} and @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.VmtQlZqeraTv0Eer]{Skyfire Wings} as 3rd-rank occult innate spells. You can cast each of these occult innate spells once per day.

Dishonored Contrarian.name: Dishonored Contrarian
Dishonored Contrarian.description: When the going gets tough, the tough fight tooth and nail to build a better life—literally. Your fellow vlakas might carry hope, dreams, and unending optimism in their hearts, but you've always found it harder to look on the bright side, and you've done some dubious things to get by. Whether you've lied, cheated, stolen, or taken some lives, you know that you did what it took to survive and thrive in a cold and callous galaxy. You become trained in one of the following skills of your choice: Deception, Intimidation, or Thievery. If you select Deception, you gain the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feats.Item.HEBXaS656MZTiWFu]{Lengthy Diversion} skill feat. If you select Intimidation, you gain the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feats.Item.gUqvezs2zzoTXFAI]{Group Coercion} skill feat. If you select Thievery, you gain the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feats.Item.hVZbnsDuXihggylt]{Subtle Theft} skill feat.

Disperse!.name: Disperse!
Disperse!.description:
When you're fully decked out in your Hellknight regalia, just the presence of your fearsome visage drives enemies back. Attempt an @Check[intimidation] check against an enemy within 30 feet who can perceive you.

Critical Success You push your target up to 10 feet away from you. You can Stride after it, but you must move the same distance and in the same direction.

Success You push your target back 5 feet. You can Stride after it, but you must move the same distance and in the same direction.

Distant Feint.name: Distant Feint
Distant Feint.description: You're an incredible actor, and you can use your over-the-top bits and dramatic gestures to throw a foe off its game. If you're wielding a ranged weapon, you can @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feint} against an opponent at a range of 100 feet, rather than just within melee reach. If you succeed, the opponent is @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against your melee and ranged attacks, rather than only your melee attacks.

Distant Flare.name: Distant Flare
Distant Flare.description: Your concentration lets you fire your solar flare even further. Increase the range increment of your solar flare by 15 feet.

Distant Telepath.name: Distant Telepath
Distant Telepath.description:
Whether through training or innate talent, you've expanded the range at which you can telepathically communicate. Increase the range of your limited telepathy by 15 feet.

Special You can select this feat more than once.

Dive for Cover.name: Dive for Cover
Dive for Cover.description: When threatened, you can quickly take a dive and find somewhere to hunker down. You @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leap}, land @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}, and immediately @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.ust1jJSCZQUhBZIz]{Take Cover}, which allows you to hunker down and gain greater cover against ranged attacks.

Diverse Schemes.name: Diverse Schemes
Diverse Schemes.description: You're an efficient multitasker, and you always have more than one goal in mind or scheme on the go. You can maintain twice your Charisma modifier of assets.

Divine Bond.name: Divine Bond
Divine Bond.description: As a disciple of a god, you wield some of their divine power. You become trained in the listed divine skill associated with the deity and add the listed cleric spells to your spell list and spell repertoire as signature spells. If you were already trained in the listed divine skill, you instead become trained in another skill of your choice. You become bound by that deity's anathema and can receive that deity's divine sanctification.

prerequisites.value: connection with divine spellcasting, you worship a deity

Divine Guidance.name: Guía divina
Divine Guidance.description: Estás tan inmerso en las escrituras divinas que encuentras en tus textos significado y guía para cualquier situación. Invierte 10 minutos @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d9gbpiQjChYDYA2L]{Descifrando escritura} en escrituras religiosas de tu dios o de tu filosofía mientras meditas acerca de un problema en particular o acertijo al que te enfrentas y después haz una prueba de Religión (CD a determinar por el DJ). Si tienes éxito, desentierras un paisaje, parábola o aforismo relevante que te puede ayudar a avanzar o cambiar tu forma de pensar para ayudarte a resolver el acertijo.

Do You Know Who I Work For?.name: Do You Know Who I Work For?
Do You Know Who I Work For?.description: Throwing your corporation's name around adds weight to your threats. When you use Intimidation to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.tHCqgwjtQtzNqVvd]{Coerce} or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} a target who knows about your corporation, a success becomes a critical success.

Don't Touch That!.name: Don't Touch That!
Don't Touch That!.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger An ally you can observe triggers a trap.

You give a sharp, panicked reprimand to an unobservant ally. This feat gains the visual or auditory trait, whichever is appropriate for your warning. Attempt a Delve Lore check against the hazard's stealth DC.

Critical Success Your warning comes just in time. You prevent the trap from being triggered, or you delay the activation until the start or end of your next turn (your choice).

Success Your ally gains a +1 circumstance bonus to AC against the trap's next attack, or to their next saving throw against the trap's effects.

Critical Failure Your sharp warning only startles your ally, leaving them @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against the trap's next attack.

Don't You Die on Me.name: Don't You Die on Me
Don't You Die on Me.description: You encourage your ally to hang on and keep going, despite life-threatening wounds or other serious injuries that might take them out. Select an adjacent dying ally. Reduce the target's dying value by 1. If this would reduce their dying value to 0, they lose the dying condition, don't increase their wounded condition, and remain @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious}. The targeted ally then becomes temporarily immune to Don't You Die on Me for 1 hour.

Double Draw.name: Double Draw
Double Draw.description: You can efficiently move held equipment between your four arms. You Interact twice, using each to draw, stow, or swap items you have.

Double Tap.name: Double Tap
Double Tap.description:
Requirements You're wielding a gun.

You fire two shots at the same target in quick succession. You @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.sLikawnrJJzHMYeC]{Aim} and then make two Strikes against your mark. Apply the multiple attack penalty normally. If both attacks hit, combine their damage. You add any precision damage only once, to the attack of your choice. Apply the target's resistances and weaknesses only once.

Down to the Wire.name: Down to the Wire
Down to the Wire.description:
Trigger The final action on your turn is a 1-action directive.

You act quickly to show your teammates exactly how it's done. Resolve the directive you just issued as though it was a 2-action version instead of the 1-action that you used.

Draconic Lethality.name: Draconic Lethality
Draconic Lethality.description:
Your draconic body is a weapon. When you select this feat, you gain one of the following unarmed attacks of your choice: claw, horn, jaws, or tail. Each of these attacks is in the brawling weapon group and has the listed damage die and traits.

  • Claw 1d6 slashing (agile, finesse, unarmed)
  • Horn 1d6 piercing (finesse, unarmed)
  • Jaws 1d6 piercing (grapple, unarmed)
  • Tail 1d6 bludgeoning (sweep, trip, unarmed)

At 5th level, whenever you get a critical hit with one of these attacks, you get its critical specialization effect.

Special You can take this feat four times. Each time you do, select a different attack from the options listed above.

Draconic Senses.name: Draconic Senses
Draconic Senses.description: You have an impressive sense of smell, passed down through the generations from a dragon ancestor. You gain imprecise scent with a range of 40 feet. The GM might double the range if you're downwind from the creature or halve the range if you're upwind, at their discretion.

Dragon's Tenacity.name: Dragon's Tenacity
Dragon's Tenacity.description: Your mind and body have the resilience of your dragon progenitors. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saving throws against fear effects, sleep effects, and effects that would cause you to become @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.6uEgoh53GbXuHpTF]{Paralyzed}. This bonus increases to +2 against spells and magic items that have these effects.

0.label: Against effects that would make you Paralyzed

1.label: Against magic effects that would make you Paralyzed

Dragonkin Breath.name: Dragonkin Breath
Dragonkin Breath.description:
Your exhalations are infused with energy, like your dragon ancestors of old. You can exhale a @Template[type:cone|distance:15] that deals @Damage[ceil(@actor.level/2)d4[@actor.flags.sf2e.dragonkinBreath.damageType]|options:area-damage] damage (@Check[reflex|against:class-spell|basic] save against the higher of your class DC or spell DC). After using this attack, you can't use it again for [[/r 1d4 #Recharge Dragonkin Breath]]{1d4 rounds}. At 3rd level and every 2 levels thereafter, the damage increases by 1d4.

Special When you select this feat, choose your breath's damage type and weapon group: acid (corrosive), bludgeoning (hammer), cold (cryo), electricity (shock), fire (flame), piercing (spear), slashing (knife), or sonic (sonic). This choice is permanent. This ability has the trait associated with the type of damage it deals.

Dragonkin Lore.name: Dragonkin Lore
Dragonkin Lore.description:
You're trained in skills passed down through generations of dragonkin. You gain the trained proficiency rank in Athletics and Society. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.

You also gain the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feats.Item.BocFD2KV0qgUC76x]{Additional Lore} general feat for Dragonkin Lore.

Dragonkin Weapon Familiarity.name: Dragonkin Weapon Familiarity
Dragonkin Weapon Familiarity.description:
You wield weapons favored by the Skyfire Legion. You are trained with the skyfire sword, flamethrower, and machine gun. In addition, you gain access to all uncommon weapons with the dragonkin trait. For the purposes of proficiency, you treat any of these that are martial weapons as simple weapons and any that are advanced weapons as martial weapons.

At 5th level, whenever you get a critical hit with one of these weapons, you get its critical specialization effect.

Dramatic Blocking.name: Dramatic Blocking
Dramatic Blocking.description: Thanks to years of practice, you know how to use every inch of the stage and give a fantastic performance even in tight quarters. While you can act, you aren't @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.VRSef5y1LmL2Hkjf]{Undetected}, or flanking creatures of your level or lower.

Dramatic Reading.name: Dramatic Reading
Dramatic Reading.description:
You recite a memorable catchphrase or monologue delivered by a famous media character. Attempt a @Check[media-lore|against:will] or @Check[performance|against:will] check against the Will DC of a single enemy within 30 feet.

You can target up to two targets within range if you have expert proficiency in Media Lore or Performance, four if you're a master, and eight if you're legendary.

Critical Success The target takes a –1 status penalty to Perception checks and Will saves for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feat-effects.Item.mpoTONLPMyb14mO9]{Effect: Dramatic Reading (Critical Success)}

Success The target takes a –1 status penalty to Perception checks and Will saves for 1 round.

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feat-effects.Item.IPIYAY9bTGetPw12]{Effect: Dramatic Reading (Success)}

Critical Failure The target is temporarily immune to Dramatic Reading for 1 hour.

Drift Blink.name: Drift Blink
Drift Blink.description:
Frequency once per minute

Trigger An enemy's Strike would hit you, and you weren't already @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed}, @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden}, or undetected to that enemy.

You momentarily slip into the Drift, becoming concealed against the triggering Strike. If the flat check for concealment fails, the Strike misses you. After resolving the triggering Strike, you reemerge from the Drift in an unoccupied space adjacent to your original square.

Drift Hop.name: Drift Hop
Drift Hop.description:
Frequency once per day

You travel across the battlefield via the Drift. You teleport up to a distance equal to your Speed within your line of sight. If you're in the Drift, the distance you can teleport is doubled.

Drift Strike.name: Drift Strike
Drift Strike.description:
Frequency once every 10 minutes

Requirements Your last action was a melee Strike that critically hit a creature.

You launch the creature you hit with the required Strike into the Drift to reposition it across the battlefield. The creature is teleported to a location of your choice up to a distance of 20 feet from its starting location and within your line of sight. If you're in the Drift, the distance you can teleport the creature is doubled. The creature must be able to fit in its new location, and its new location must be unoccupied. The creature can attempt a @Check[will|against:class-spell] save.

Critical Success The creature is unaffected.

Success The distance you can teleport the creature is halved, and it can't be moved to a location that is hazardous or would result in a fall.

Failure You teleport the creature up to the noted distance.

Critical Failure As failure, but the distance you can teleport the creature is doubled.

Drift-Touched.name: Drift-Touched
Drift-Touched.description:
Frequency once per day

You were born or gestated inside the Drift, and hyperspace is always a part of you. With a thought, you seize a fragment of the Drift and temporarily transplant it onto the battlefield as an intangible barrier of colorful light. This shimmering field appears within 30 feet and is straight and vertical, stretching up to 10 feet long and 10 feet high. The barrier grants concealment to creatures targeted through it, and it sheds colorful bright light for 10 feet on each side and dim light for the next 10 feet. You can ignore any concealment granted by the barrier. The barrier lasts for 5 rounds.

Drop Tail.name: Drop Tail
Drop Tail.description:
Trigger You would be reduced to 0 Hit Points.

Requirements You have a tail.

In an embarrassing act of desperation, you sacrifice your tail to save your life. You're reduced to 1 Hit Point, rather than 0 Hit Points, and don't gain the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.fBnFDH2MTzgFijKf]{Unconscious} or wounded conditions. Your tail falls off and flails around wildly, distracting your foes. You Stride up to your Speed, and don't trigger reactions due to this movement. Your tail grows back over 24 hours. While your tail is regrowing, you don't have a tail, your Speed is reduced by 5 feet, and you take a –2 status penalty to Acrobatics checks.

Dual Aim.name: Dual Aim
Dual Aim.description:
Your sharpshooter skills improve. You can have two marks at a time instead of one. When you @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.sLikawnrJJzHMYeC]{Aim}, you can select two marks, rather than one.

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feat-effects.Item.SjauZALDFxxkSNbl]{Effect: Dual Aim}

Dual Bond.name: Dual Bond
Dual Bond.description: While some claim you're incapable of forming a partner bond as deep as other dragonkin can, it's undeniable that you have more flexibility and freedom when it comes to bonding. You can maintain any number of partner bonds at once. Your bonded partners don't automatically count as being bonded with one another.

Dubious Knowledge.name: Conocimiento dudoso
Dubious Knowledge.description: Eres un tesoro de información, pero no toda ella procede de fuentes reputadas. Cuando sufres un fallo (pero no un fallo crítico) en una prueba de Recordar conocimiento utilizando cualquier habilidad, averiguas la respuesta correcta y una respuesta errónea, pero no tienes forma alguna de diferenciar cuál es cuál. Esto puede ocurrir si no saber algo es significativo, pero no si es bueno o malo.

prerequisites.value: rango entrenado en una habilidad que dispone de la acción Recordar conocimiento

Eager Assistant.name: Eager Assistant
Eager Assistant.description: You love helping your friends and allies achieve their goals. At the start of your turn, you gain one additional reaction, which you can use only to Aid.

Eager Combatant.name: Eager Combatant
Eager Combatant.description:
Trigger You roll Athletics or Intimidation for initiative.

You eagerly stride into battle, giving no thought to the consequences. You Stride in a straight line directly toward an enemy.

Eclipse Strike.name: Eclipse Strike
Eclipse Strike.description:
Your attacks create a brilliant eclipse that veil you from the enemy's view. Make a Strike with your solar weapon or your solar flare. On a hit, you create an impressive display of solar energy between you and your foe. Increase the level of cover you receive from your enemy by one step. Lesser cover becomes standard cover, or standard cover becomes greater cover in the case of creatures at least one size category larger than you. This effect lasts until the start of your next turn.

Graviton-Attuned For the duration, if you don't have any cover against an attack targeting you, you gain lesser cover against that attack.

Photon-Attuned For the duration, if the target you struck provides you cover against an enemy's attack, that enemy takes a –1 circumstance penalty to their attack roll.

Effortless Concentration.name: Concentración sin esfuerzo
Effortless Concentration.description:
Desencadenante Empieza tu turno.

Mantienes tus conjuros activos casi sin pensarlo. Obtienes de inmediato los efectos de la acción de Mantener para uno de tus conjuros de clase.

Effortless Influencer.name: Effortless Influencer
Effortless Influencer.description:
You've become such a master manipulator that spotting an opening to ply your influence has become second nature. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feats.Item.W6Gl9ePmItfDHji0]{Assurance} skill feat three times for Deception, Diplomacy, and Intimidation. Furthermore, when you succeed at a check with Deception, Diplomacy, or Intimidation, allies within 60 feet who witnessed your success gain a +1 status bonus to the next check they attempt with that skill within 1 minute (or a +2 bonus if your check was a critical success).

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feat-effects.Item.ZQM4vfHEKgxvNJik]{Effect: Effortless Influencer}

Eldritch Bond.name: Eldritch Bond
Eldritch Bond.description: You channel strange power from beyond this reality, granting creatures in your bond the power to reform their bodies into powerful, aberrant shapes. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.Y8Y0LS6sh4pkxPsq]{Eldritch Bond} epiphany spell.

Elebrian Cantrip.name: Elebrian Cantrip
Elebrian Cantrip.description:
You enhance your performances with delightful magical tricks, going far beyond normal sleight of hand. Choose one cantrip from the following list: @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.h7IhypLwItepwhou]{Adhere}, @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.0zU8CPejjQFnhZFI]{Figment}, @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.Qw3fnUlaUbnn7ipC]{Prestidigitation}, or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.pwzdSlJgYqN7bs2w]{Telekinetic Hand}. You can cast this cantrip as an arcane innate spell at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell rank equal to half your level rounded up.

Special You can select this feat more than once. If you do, you must select a different cantrip.

Elebrian Lore.name: Elebrian Lore
Elebrian Lore.description:
Your people's dwindling numbers hasn't stopped you from learning everything there is to know about your ancestral past. You are trained in Arcana and Society. If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice.

You also gain the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feats.Item.BocFD2KV0qgUC76x]{Additional Lore} general feat for Elebrian Lore.

Elebrian Magic.name: Elebrian Magic
Elebrian Magic.description:
Your arcane aptitude grows as you learn how to better entrance an audience with magic. Choose one 1st-rank spell from the following list: @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.vLA0q0WOK2YPuJs6]{Charm}, @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.V1cojmrEOWkJ1yPF]{Glow Up}, @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.i35dpZFI7jZcRoBo]{Illusory Disguise}, or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.yV7Ouzaoe7DHLESI]{Ventriloquism}. You can cast this spell as an arcane innate spell once per day.

Special You can select this feat more than once. If you do, you must select a different spell.

Electrical Engineer.name: Electrical Engineer
Electrical Engineer.description: You can fuel battery-powered devices by drawing electricity from different sources. Doing so takes 1 minute of work and an adjacent source of power appropriate to the device. If the source of power is a technological creature or hazard, it must have been destroyed within the last 10 minutes and provides charges equal to twice its level. If the source is a facility capable of charging a battery, the battery-powered device operates as if the battery were always fully charged. If you're a master in Crafting, you can connect a device to a power source as a 3-action activity. If you're legendary, it takes 1 action.

Electrical Shielding.name: Electrical Shielding
Electrical Shielding.description: Your body is insulated from electrical attacks. You gain electricity resistance equal to half your level. Additionally, you gain the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.mrcKklMzhRG4WcbH]{Redirect Current} reaction.

Electromagnetic Whiskers.name: Electromagnetic Whiskers
Electromagnetic Whiskers.description: You've honed your whiskers' sensitivity to the degree that you can sense the movement of the weak electric fields emitted by potential enemies. You gain electromagnetic sense as an imprecise sense out to 15 feet. Electromagnetic sense allows you to detect nearby living and technological creatures, but you might have to use the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek} action to find an undetected creature in an environment with too much electromagnetic radiation, such as inside the engine room of a spaceship or near a powerful source of radio waves.

Elusive Target.name: Elusive Target
Elusive Target.description:
Trigger A Strike targeting you fails.

You move out of the way as you elude your attackers. You Step.

Embrace the Magic.name: Embrace the Magic
Embrace the Magic.description:
You understand that the galaxy is a wondrous place full of arcane mysteries and strange phenomena. You can cast the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.gpzpAAAJ1Lza2JVl]{Detect Magic} cantrip as an arcane innate spell at will. A cantrip is heightened to a spell rank equal to half your level rounded up.

In addition, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to skill checks to Identify Magic.

Emotional Defiance.name: Emotional Defiance
Emotional Defiance.description:
Frequency once per hour

Trigger You fail a Will saving throw against a mental effect.

You refuse to allow others to influence or manipulate your emotions. Reroll the triggering saving throw and use the better result.

Emotional Maestro.name: Emotional Maestro
Emotional Maestro.description: Your ability to detect the emotions of others is unparalleled. Your emotion sense becomes a precise sense with a range of 120 feet.

Empowered Scales.name: Empowered Scales
Empowered Scales.description: You catch periodic glimpses of the immediate future and can use your insight to predict your foes' moves before they make them. Once per day, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.XSujb7EsSwKl19Uu]{Bless} or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.spells.Item.Gb7SeieEvd0pL2Eh]{Sure Strike} as a 1st-rank spell. The tradition of this spell matches the tradition of the cantrip you gained from Sigiled Scales.

Encode Presence.name: Encode Presence
Encode Presence.description:
Frequency once per hour

You instinctively encode your presence, obscuring your identity and scrambling your visual appearance to technological visual sensors. You become @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.DmAIPqOBomZ7H95W]{Concealed} to all technological visual sensors, such as security cameras, ocular cybernetic augmentations, and the visual processors of technological constructs, for 1 minute. As the nature of this effect still leaves your location obvious, you can't use this concealment to Hide or @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak}.

Encore.name: Encore
Encore.description:
Frequency once per day

You consistently rehearse your best bits so that you're always ready for an encore. During this turn, the next action you take can be an ability with a frequency of once per day and that you've used only once today. This doesn't allow you to reuse spell slots or abilities from 20th-level feats or features.

Encyclopedic Recall.name: Encyclopedic Recall
Encyclopedic Recall.description:
Frequency once per round

You swiftly calculate and cross-reference several subjects at once. You instantly use up to three Recall Knowledge actions. If you have any special abilities or free actions that would normally be triggered when you Recall Knowledge, you can't use them for these actions. At 13th level, you can instead use up to four Recall Knowledge actions. At 17th level, you can instead use up to five Recall Knowledge actions.

Endlessly Adaptive.name: Endlessly Adaptive
Endlessly Adaptive.description: Your varied life experiences let you adapt to nearly any situation. When you gain skill feats using adaptive talent, you gain two additional skill feats. In addition, you can adapt to the day's challenges by spending 10 minutes to plan. If you do, you can reselect the feats chosen with adaptive talent as if you'd made your daily preparations. You can't trade out feats with limited-use abilities that you've already used that day.

Enduring Echolocation.name: Enduring Echolocation
Enduring Echolocation.description: You perceive your surroundings as much by echolocation as by your other senses. Your echolocation becomes a precise sense to a range of 60 feet (or 120 feet underwater), in addition to the imprecise sense out to 120 feet (or 240 feet underwater).

Energy Consumption.name: Energy Consumption
Energy Consumption.description:
Your body has adapted over to consume the excess energy it uses to shield itself, allowing it to neutralize other forms of energy that could harm it. When you use your @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feats.Item.hvWJRc0dGF3ivrb6]{Energy Deflection} reaction, if the attack was a failure or critical failure, you gain temporary Hit Points equal to your level; you also gain the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feats.Item.lmowZWTzJaZfM3bb]{Energy Shielding} feat (selecting a different type of energy). These temporary Hit Points and the Energy Shielding feat last 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.sf2e.feat-effects.Item.g1J6DOxBQkacvbyE]{Effect: Energy Consumption}

Energy Deflection.name: Energy Deflection
Energy Deflection.description:
Trigger You are the target of a ranged attack that would deal at least one type of damage you selected with Energy Shielding.

Requirements You're aware of the attack and are not @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} against it.

You leverage the magical energy clinging to your body to counter similar harmful attacks. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

Energy Infusion.name: Energy Infusion
Energy Infusion.description: You infuse your attacks with necromantic or radiant energies from beyond the material Universe. You infuse your attacks with spiritual energy for 1 minute. All weapons you're wielding and your unarmed Strikes become magical and either deal 1 additional spirit damage and gain the unholy trait against living creatures, or deal 1 additional spirit damage and gain the holy trait against undead.

Energy Shielding.name: Energy Shielding
Energy Shielding.description:
While traversing the Diaspora, you've witnessed countless magical anomalies and survived to tell the tale. This persistent exposure to magical energy has rubbed off on you, leaving traces of magic behind that shield your body from harmful energy. Select one of the following types of energy damage: acid, cold, electricity, fire, or sonic. You gain resistance 5 to that damage type.

Special You can select this feat multiple times. Each time you do, select a different energy type.

Enhanced Echolocation.name: Enhanced Echolocation
Enhanced Echolocation.description: You've learned to quiet your other senses and focus your attention on your echolocation. The range of your echolocation imprecise sense doubles to 60 feet (or 120 feet underwater), and you gain the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.actions.Item.0vqXr3SYakIa19k3]{Focus Senses} action.

Enlarge Quantum Field.name: Enlarge Quantum Field
Enlarge Quantum Field.description: Your quantum field slowly encroaches on reality. Increase your quantum field's radius by 10 feet. Until your quantum field deactivates, once per turn when you Sustain the quantum field, increase its radius by an additional 5 feet (to a maximum of 50 additional feet).

Enlightened Rivener.name: Enlightened Rivener
Enlightened Rivener.description: You've mastered your anger and can maintain the rivener transformation indefinitely. You permanently become Large, and your reach increases by 5 feet. You can use Enter Rivener State once per hour, rather than once per day. When you Enter Rivener State, your size and reach don't increase, you don't become stupefied, and you don't become @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} when the transformation ends. You still gain the bonus to damage.

Enlightenment.name: Enlightenment
Enlightenment.description: You understand the true nature of your connection and how it stretches across the vast pillars of reality. Your vitality network has a maximum capacity of 200 Hit Points and regains 20 Hit Points at the start of each turn instead of 8. You can bond with any number of willing creatures.

Enter Rivener State.name: Enter Rivener State
Enter Rivener State.description:
You embrace your anger, willingly entering a controlled rivener state and maintaining your mental faculties. Your body grows and expands, becoming Large. Your equipment grows with you, but returns to its natural size if removed. Your reach increases by 5 feet, and you gain a +2 status bonus to melee damage. You become @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1}. This transformation lasts for 10 minutes, or until you choose to end it early as a single action that has the concentrate trait. When your transformation ends, you become @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.conditions.Item.HL2l2VRSaQHu9lUw]{Fatigued} for 10 minutes.

At 13th level and 17th level, the bonus damage increases by 2

Envoy Dedication.name: Envoy Dedication
Envoy Dedication.description: You gain the @UUID[Compendium.sf2e.class-features.Item.f9dNcZi9kzbaGl8M]{Envoy Directives} class feature, but do not gain the Lead by Example benefits of the Get 'Em! envoy directive. You become trained in Deception, Diplomacy, or Intimidation plus another skill of your choice. If you were already trained in Deception, Diplomacy, and Intimidation, you instead become trained in an additional skill of your choice. You also become trained in envoy class DC.

Esoteric Education.name: Esoteric Education
Esoteric Education.description:
For all their practicality, broader fields of study don't capture your imagination when there are more specialized disciplines you might explore. Choose two Lore skill subcategories. You gain the Additional Lore general feat for both skills.

Special You can take this feat three times. Each time you do, you gain the Additional Lore general feat for a new subcategory of Lore, and you become trained in one other Lore skill subcategory of your choice.

Etheric.name: Etheric
Etheric.description: You became a borai through a botched resurrection attempt—perhaps a magic spell was disrupted, a religious rite went awry, or faulty technology went haywire, resulting in your condition. Your soul is loosely tethered to your body, allowing you to temporarily shield your living form from the ravages of the void.
